intro: Acilepis tonkinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin acacia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable in some areas.
